Precautions: Drink plenty of water; Urinate after intercourse; Proper perineal hygiene; Cranberry products; Avoid holding urine
Medicines: Trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole; Nitrofurantoin; Fosfomycin; Ciprofloxacin; Phenazopyridine
Prescriptions: Trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole 160/800 mg oral BID for 3 days; Nitrofurantoin 100 mg oral BID for 5 days; Fosfomycin 3 g oral single dose; Ciprofloxacin 250 mg oral BID for 3 days; Phenazopyridine 200 mg oral TID for 2 days (symptomatic relief)
Diet Plan: Plenty of fluids (water); Probiotics (yogurt); Foods rich in vitamin C (fortify urine acidity); High-fiber diet; Cranberry juice (may help)
Food Restrictions: Caffeine; Alcohol; Spicy foods; Soda; Deli meats (nitrites)

Symptoms: Severe flank or back pain (colicky); Hematuria; Nausea/vomiting; Urgency to urinate; Sweating
Precautions: Hydration (2-3 L/day); Diet low in sodium; Avoid excessive protein; Manage obesity; Strain urine to catch stone
Medicines: Pain management (NSAIDs, opioids); Alpha-blockers (Tamsulosin); Thiazide diuretics (if recurrent calcium stones); Allopurinol (if uric acid stones); Citrate supplements
Prescriptions: Ibuprofen 400 mg oral QID PRN; Oxycodone 5–10 mg oral QID PRN for severe pain; Tamsulosin 0.4 mg oral daily for 4 weeks; Hydrochlorothiazide 25 mg oral once daily (if hypercalciuria); Potassium citrate 10 mEq oral TID
Diet Plan: Fluids (water, citrus juices for citrate); Citrus fruits (lemon, orange); Low-oxalate vegetables; Whole grains; Calcium with meals
Food Restrictions: "High-oxalate foods (spinach, beets, nuts); Excess salt; Animal protein; Sugary drinks (soda); Excess vitamin C supplements"

Symptoms: Recurrent seizures (focal or generalized); Temporary confusion; Uncontrolled jerking movements; Loss of consciousness; Psychic symptoms
Precautions: Medication adherence; Avoid sleep deprivation; Limit alcohol; Safety measures (helmets, showers); Treat underlying causes
Medicines: Valproate; Levetiracetam; Lamotrigine; Carbamazepine; Clonazepam
Prescriptions: Valproate 500 mg oral BID; Levetiracetam 500 mg oral BID; Lamotrigine 100 mg oral once daily; Carbamazepine 200 mg oral BID; Clonazepam 0.5 mg oral at bedtime
Diet Plan: Regular meals; Low-glycemic foods; Adequate hydration; Folate-rich foods (for valproate use); Mediterranean diet
Food Restrictions: Flashing lights (if photosensitive); Excess caffeine; Alcohol (lowers seizure threshold); Skip medications; Nicotine

Symptoms: Recurrent headaches (often unilateral, throbbing); Photophobia/phonophobia; Nausea/vomiting; Aura (visual disturbances); Neck stiffness
Precautions: Regular sleep; Identify and avoid triggers (stress, hunger); Caffeine moderation; Stress reduction; Migraine prophylaxis if frequent
Medicines: NSAIDs (Ibuprofen); Triptans (Sumatriptan); Anti-nausea (Ondansetron); Beta-blockers (Propranolol); Antidepressants (Amitriptyline)
Prescriptions: Sumatriptan 50 mg oral at onset of headache; Ibuprofen 400 mg oral PRN; Ondansetron 4 mg oral as needed; Propranolol 40 mg oral BID (prophylaxis); Amitriptyline 25 mg oral at bedtime (prophylaxis)
Diet Plan: Magnesium-rich foods (nuts, whole grains); Riboflavin (Vitamin B2) foods (eggs, lean meats); Hydration; Ginger (for nausea); Balanced regular meals
Food Restrictions: Aged cheeses; Chocolate; Red wine; Processed meats (nitrites); MSG-containing foods

Symptoms: Abdominal pain relieved by defecation; Bloating; Altered bowel habits (diarrhea, constipation or both); Gas; Mucus in stool
Precautions: Dietary fiber adjustment; Low-FODMAP diet; Regular exercise; Manage stress; Adequate hydration
Medicines: Fiber supplements (Psyllium); Loperamide (if diarrhea); Osmotic laxatives (Polyethylene glycol); Antispasmodics (Hyoscine); Low-dose antidepressant (TCAs, SSRIs)
Prescriptions: Psyllium 5 g oral daily; Loperamide 4 mg oral after first stool then 2 mg after each loose stool (max 8 mg/day); Polyethylene glycol 17 g oral daily (if constipation); Hyoscine (Scopolamine) 10 mg oral TID before meals; Amitriptyline 10–25 mg oral at bedtime (if IBS-D)
Diet Plan: Low-FODMAP diet (avoid certain carbs); Peppermint tea; Bananas; Rice and oats; Lean proteins (chicken, fish)
Food Restrictions: High-FODMAP foods (onions, garlic, apples); Caffeine; Alcohol; Fatty fried foods; Artificial sweeteners (sorbitol, mannitol)

Symptoms: Abdominal pain (often RLQ); Diarrhea (may be bloody); Weight loss; Fever; Fatigue; Perianal disease (fistulas)
Precautions: Smoking cessation (prevents flares); Regular follow-up (monitor disease); Nutrition support; Hydration; Vaccinations
Medicines: 5-ASA (Mesalamine); Corticosteroids (Prednisone); Azathioprine; Biologics (Infliximab); Antibiotics (Metronidazole)
Prescriptions: Prednisone 40 mg oral once daily (induction) taper; Azathioprine 2 mg/kg oral once daily; Infliximab 5 mg/kg IV at 0,2,6 weeks then every 8 weeks; Metronidazole 500 mg oral TID for 10 days; Nutritional supplement shakes
Diet Plan: Low-residue diet during flare; Lean proteins; Vitamin-rich fruits/vegetables (cooked if needed); Probiotics; Small frequent meals
Food Restrictions: High-fat foods; Dairy (if lactose intolerant); Spicy foods; Alcohol; High-fiber raw foods during flare

Symptoms: Bloody diarrhea; Abdominal pain (crampy, lower abdomen); Tenesmus (urge to defecate); Weight loss; Fatigue
Precautions: Regular monitoring; Avoid NSAIDs; Stress management; Complete vaccinations; Emergency care for severe flares
Medicines: 5-ASA (Mesalamine oral/suppository); Corticosteroids (Budesonide, Prednisone); Azathioprine; Biologics (Adalimumab); IV fluids (if severe)
Prescriptions: Mesalamine 2.4 g oral daily (maintenance); Budesonide 9 mg oral once daily (induction); Prednisone 40 mg oral once daily taper; Azathioprine 2 mg/kg oral once daily; Adalimumab 160 mg SC at week 0, 80 mg at week 2, then 40 mg every other week
Diet Plan: Low-fiber foods during flares; Lean proteins; Hydration (water, electrolyte drinks); Probiotic yogurt; Omega-3 rich foods
Food Restrictions: High-fiber raw fruits/vegetables (in exacerbation); Spicy foods; Alcohol; Caffeine; High-fat fried foods

Symptoms: BMI ≥30 kg/m²; Increased waist circumference; Fatigue; Joint pain; Snoring (if sleep apnea)
Precautions: Calorie-restricted diet; Regular physical activity; Behavioral therapy; Sleep hygiene; Medical evaluation
Medicines: Orlistat; GLP-1 agonists (Liraglutide); Phentermine; Metformin (if insulin resistance); Bariatric surgery referral (if severe)
Prescriptions: Orlistat 120 mg oral TID with meals for 12 weeks; Liraglutide 3.0 mg SC once daily; Phentermine 37.5 mg oral once daily (short-term); Metformin 500 mg oral BID (off-label for weight); Refer for bariatric surgery evaluation
Diet Plan: High-protein foods (legumes, chicken); Whole grains; Fruits and vegetables; Healthy fats (avocado, nuts); Water (no-calorie drinks)
Food Restrictions: Sugary beverages and snacks; Processed fast foods; Excess refined carbs; High-fat fried foods; Alcohol

Symptoms: Itchy, red, inflamed skin; Dry, scaly patches; Lichenification (thick skin); Crusting/oozing (when acute)
Precautions: Daily moisturization; Avoid irritants (perfumes, soaps); Bleach baths (dilute) for colonization; Manage stress; Topical steroids as prescribed
Medicines: Topical corticosteroids; Calcineurin inhibitors (Tacrolimus); Antihistamines (Cetirizine); Cyclosporine (severe); Dupilumab
Prescriptions: Hydrocortisone 1% cream apply BID; Tacrolimus ointment 0.1% apply BID; Cetirizine 10 mg oral once daily; Cyclosporine 3 mg/kg oral once daily (short-term); Dupilumab 600 mg SC day1, then 300 mg SC every 2 weeks
Diet Plan: Lean protein; Vitamin D-rich foods; Probiotics (yogurt); Anti-inflammatory omega-3s; Hydrating fruits/vegetables
Food Restrictions: Cow's milk (if dairy allergy); Eggs (if allergy); Nuts; Soy (if allergy); High-histamine foods (aged cheese)

Symptoms: Raised red plaques with silvery scales (often elbows/knees); Itching or burning; Nail pitting; Joint pain (psoriatic arthritis)
Precautions: Moisturize skin daily; Avoid triggers (stress, injury); Sun exposure (moderate); Gently remove scales; Treat infections promptly
Medicines: Topical corticosteroids; Vitamin D analogs (Calcipotriene); Methotrexate; Biologics (Etanercept, Ustekinumab); Phototherapy
Prescriptions: Calcipotriene cream 0.005% apply BID; Clobetasol 0.05% cream apply daily (up to 2 wk); Methotrexate 15 mg oral weekly; Etanercept 50 mg SC weekly; Ustekinumab 45 mg SC at weeks 0 and 4, then every 12 wk
Diet Plan: Omega-3 fish; Olive oil; Leafy greens; Turmeric (anti-inflammatory); Whole grains
Food Restrictions: "Alcohol; Red meat; Dairy (worsening inflammation); Nightshades (tomatoes, peppers in some); Gluten (if sensitivity)"

Symptoms: Pimples (papules, pustules); Blackheads; Whiteheads; Oily skin; Scarring (severe cases)
Precautions: Gentle skin cleansing; Non-comedogenic products; Avoid picking skin; Diet low in high-glycemic foods; Manage stress
Medicines: Benzoyl peroxide; Topical retinoids (Tretinoin); Antibiotics (Clindamycin); Oral isotretinoin (severe); Hormonal therapy (oral contraceptives)
Prescriptions: Benzoyl peroxide 5% gel apply daily; Tretinoin 0.025% cream apply nightly; Clindamycin 1% gel BID; Isotretinoin 20 mg oral daily for 12 weeks; Oral contraceptive (ethinyl estradiol/norgestimate) daily
Diet Plan: Low glycemic index diet; Foods rich in zinc (oysters, pumpkin seeds); Vitamin A foods (carrots, sweet potatoes); Green tea; Hydration
Food Restrictions: High glycemic foods (sweets, white bread); Dairy (may worsen acne in some); Greasy fried foods; Excess chocolate; High-sugar drinks

Symptoms: Sneezing; Runny or stuffy nose; Itchy eyes/nose/throat; Watery eyes; Postnasal drip
Precautions: "Avoid allergens (pollen, dust mites, pet dander); Use air filters; Keep windows closed in high pollen; Nasal saline rinse; Allergy immunotherapy (shots)"
Medicines: Antihistamines (Cetirizine, Fexofenadine); Intranasal corticosteroids (Fluticasone nasal); Decongestants (pseudoephedrine); Leukotriene inhibitors (Montelukast); Nasal saline sprays
Prescriptions: Cetirizine 10 mg oral once daily; Fexofenadine 180 mg oral once daily; Fluticasone nasal spray 2 sprays per nostril daily; Pseudoephedrine 60 mg oral Q4-6hr as needed; Montelukast 10 mg oral once daily
Diet Plan: Honey (local raw); Probiotic yogurt; Omega-3 fish; Turmeric (anti-inflammatory); Green tea
Food Restrictions: Dairy (may increase mucus); Sugar-rich foods; Alcohol; Processed foods; MSG-containing foods

Symptoms: Fever; Itchy vesicular rash starting on face and trunk; Rapid progression to pustules and scabs; Fatigue
Precautions: Vaccination (Varicella vaccine); Avoid scratching (trim nails); Keep skin clean; Isolation until lesions crust; Oatmeal baths (relief)
Medicines: Antivirals (Acyclovir); Calamine lotion; Antihistamines (Diphenhydramine); Acetaminophen for fever; Varicella immunoglobulin (for immunocompromised)
Prescriptions: Acyclovir 20 mg/kg IV every 8 hr for 7 days (severe); Acyclovir 800 mg oral 5 times/day for 7 days (adult); Calamine lotion topically PRN; Diphenhydramine 25 mg oral Q6hr PRN; Varicella-zoster immune globulin per protocol
Diet Plan: Cool baths (oatmeal); Soft bland diet; Hydration (water, juices); Foods rich in vitamins A&C; Balanced diet
Food Restrictions: Spicy or acidic foods (can irritate mouth sores); Aspirin (Reye's syndrome risk); Caffeine; Alcohol; Heavy fatty foods

Symptoms: High fever; Cough; Coryza (runny nose); Conjunctivitis; Koplik spots (oral); Maculopapular rash (spreads head to toe)
Precautions: Vaccination (MMR):contentReference[oaicite:48]{index=48}; Isolate from others; Rest and hydration; Nutrition support; Vitamin A supplementation
Medicines: Supportive care (no specific antiviral); Vitamin A supplementation; Analgesics (acetaminophen for fever); Antibiotics (if secondary infection)
Prescriptions: Vitamin A 200,000 IU oral day1 and day2 (in malnourished); Acetaminophen 500 mg oral Q6hr PRN fever; Amoxicillin 500 mg oral TID for 7 days (if otitis media); Dexamethasone 0.15 mg/kg oral daily (severe); Ribavirin (in severe/immunocompromised)
Diet Plan: Vitamin A-rich foods (leafy greens, liver); Plenty of fluids; Soft fruits; Lean proteins; Oatmeal (for comfort)
Food Restrictions: Spicy foods (can irritate lesions); Aspirin in children (Reye’s syndrome risk); Raw milk; Immunocompromised exposure; Undernourished diets

Symptoms: High fever (cyclic); Chills; Sweating; Headache; Muscle aches; Anemia
Precautions: Mosquito avoidance (bed nets, repellents); Prophylactic antimalarials when traveling; Screen donors; Early diagnosis/treatment
Medicines: Artemisinin-based combination therapy (Artemether/Lumefantrine); Chloroquine (sensitive strains); Doxycycline (prophylaxis); Mefloquine (prophylaxis); Primaquine (to clear hypnozoites)
Prescriptions: Artemether/Lumefantrine 20/120 mg oral (4 tabs initially then 4 tabs after 8 hr, then 4 tabs BID × days2–3); Chloroquine 600 mg oral base once, then 300 mg at 6, 24, 48 hr; Doxycycline 100 mg oral once daily for 7 days; Mefloquine 250 mg oral once weekly (prophylaxis); Primaquine 30 mg oral once daily for 14 days (P. vivax)
Diet Plan: Hydration (oral rehydration solutions); Fruits (bananas); Complex carbs (rice, potatoes); Iron-rich foods (if anemia); Tea (non-caffeinated)
Food Restrictions: Alcohol; NSAIDs (risk of renal complications); Excess vitamin C (can degrade primaquine); Unpasteurized dairy; Undercooked meat (to avoid other infections)

Symptoms: High fever; Severe headache; Retro-orbital pain; Muscle and joint pain; Rash (often maculopapular); Low platelet count
Precautions: Mosquito control (repellents, nets):contentReference[oaicite:49]{index=49}; Early hydration; Monitor for bleeding; Avoid NSAIDs; Rest
Medicines: Supportive care; Acetaminophen; IV fluids (if dehydration); Platelet transfusion (if severe); Antibiotics (for secondary infections)
Prescriptions: Acetaminophen 500 mg oral Q6hr PRN; IV normal saline 5–10 mL/kg/hr during febrile phase; Platelet transfusion per platelet count; Doxycycline 100 mg oral BID for 5 days (if secondary infection); Ondansetron 4 mg oral TID (if nausea)
Diet Plan: Hydration (electrolyte drinks); Fruits rich in vitamin C; Broths; Crackers/bread; Balanced diet to maintain strength
Food Restrictions: NSAIDs (risk of hemorrhage); Aspirin; Alcohol; Caffeine; Salty high-sugar foods

Symptoms: Painful vesicular rash in dermatomal distribution; Burning or tingling pain; Fever; Headache; Postherpetic neuralgia (chronic pain)
Precautions: Vaccination (Shingrix) for age>50; Antiviral therapy early; Pain management; Loose clothing; Calamine lotion
Medicines: Antivirals (Acyclovir, Valacyclovir); Analgesics (NSAIDs); Neuropathic pain meds (Gabapentin, Pregabalin); Topical lidocaine; Corticosteroids (in severe)
Prescriptions: Valacyclovir 1 g oral TID for 7 days; Acyclovir 800 mg oral 5 times daily for 7 days; Gabapentin 300 mg oral TID (neuralgia); Lidocaine 5% patch applied to rash BID; Prednisone 60 mg oral daily taper for 7 days
Diet Plan: Cool compresses; Oatmeal baths; High-protein foods (repair); Fruits and vegetables; Hydration
Food Restrictions: Stress; Physical irritants on rash; Spicy foods; Excess sugar; Alcohol

Symptoms: Erythema migrans rash (bull’s-eye); Fever; Fatigue; Joint pain (large joints); Neurological symptoms (Bell's palsy)
Precautions: Tick avoidance (repellent clothing); Prompt tick removal; Prophylactic doxycycline if tick attached; Check for coinfections (Babesia)
Medicines: Doxycycline; Amoxicillin; Cefuroxime; Macrolides (Azithromycin); NSAIDs for pain
Prescriptions: Doxycycline 100 mg oral BID for 10–21 days; Amoxicillin 500 mg oral TID for 14–21 days; Cefuroxime 500 mg oral BID for 14–21 days; Azithromycin 500 mg oral on day1, then 250 mg daily for 7 days; ibuprofen 400 mg oral TID PRN
Diet Plan: Anti-inflammatory foods (berries, leafy greens); Garlic (antimicrobial); Turmeric; Omega-3 fish; Probiotics
Food Restrictions: Raw cheese (Listeria risk); Alcohol (can stress liver during treatment); Processed meats; Sugary foods (immune suppression); NSAIDs (used sparingly)

Symptoms: Breast lump; Nipple discharge or retraction; Skin changes (dimpling); Swollen lymph nodes; Breast pain
Precautions: Regular screening (mammograms); Self-exams; Limit alcohol; Exercise; Healthy BMI
Medicines: Tamoxifen; Anastrozole; Letrozole; Chemotherapy (e.g., Doxorubicin); Targeted therapy (Trastuzumab)
Prescriptions: Tamoxifen 20 mg oral daily for 5 years; Anastrozole 1 mg oral daily for 5 years; Letrozole 2.5 mg oral daily for 5 years; Trastuzumab 8 mg/kg IV loading dose, then 6 mg/kg every 3 weeks; Doxorubicin 60 mg/m² IV every 21 days for 6 cycles
Diet Plan: Cruciferous vegetables; Fruits and vegetables; Whole grains; Omega-3 fish; Green tea
Food Restrictions: Alcohol; High-fat dairy; Red processed meats; Smoking (risk factor); Excess sugar

Symptoms: Urinary hesitancy; Nocturia; Weak urine stream; Erectile dysfunction; Pelvic pain
Precautions: Regular screening (PSA) for at-risk; Healthy diet (plant-based):contentReference[oaicite:50]{index=50}; Maintain physical activity; Weight control; Limit dairy intake
Medicines: Androgen deprivation (Leuprolide); Antiandrogens (Bicalutamide); Radiotherapy; Chemotherapy (Docetaxel); Bisphosphonates (Zoledronic acid)
Prescriptions: Leuprolide 7.5 mg IM monthly; Bicalutamide 50 mg oral daily; Docetaxel 75 mg/m² IV every 3 weeks; Zoledronic acid 4 mg IV every 4 weeks; Refer for prostatectomy evaluation
Diet Plan: Tomatoes (lycopene); Green tea; Cruciferous vegetables; Soy foods (isoflavones); Fish
Food Restrictions: High-fat dairy; Red meat; Alcohol; Processed foods; Smoking (risk factor)

Symptoms: Itching, Redness, Swelling, Rash, Dry skin, itchy
Precautions: Avoid allergens, Use mild soaps, Wear loose clothing, Keep skin hydrated, Avoid scratching
Medicines: Antihistamines, Hydrocortisone cream, Cetirizine, Diphenhydramine, Calamine lotion
Prescriptions: Apply hydrocortisone twice daily, Take antihistamine at night, Use cold compresses, Avoid hot showers, Apply moisturizer after bathing
Diet Plan: Include omega-3 fatty acids, Eat vitamin C rich foods, Stay hydrated, Include probiotics, Avoid processed foods
Food Restrictions: Avoid dairy if allergic, Limit spicy food, Avoid artificial additives, Avoid nuts if sensitive, No shellfish

Symptoms: Dry throat, Chest pain, Sore throat, Mucus production, Hoarseness
Precautions: Avoid cold drinks, Stay hydrated, Use humidifier, Avoid allergens, Rest properly
Medicines: Dextromethorphan, Guaifenesin, Benzonatate, Honey lozenges, Bromhexine

Diet Plan: Warm soups, Herbal teas, Honey and lemon, Soft foods, Ginger and turmeric
Food Restrictions: No cold drinks, Avoid fried foods, No ice creams, Limit sugar, Avoid dairy if phlegm is thick

Symptoms: Increased heart rate, Sweating, Nervousness, Irritability, Insomnia
Precautions: Practice meditation, Get regular sleep, Avoid caffeine, Stay active, Do breathing exercises
Medicines: Alprazolam, Diazepam, Buspirone, Sertraline, Clonazepam
Prescriptions: Take medication as prescribed, Practice daily meditation, Limit screen time before bed, Maintain sleep hygiene, Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT)
Diet Plan: Eat whole grains, Include magnesium-rich foods, Herbal teas like chamomile, Omega-3 rich foods, Avoid skipping meals
Food Restrictions: Avoid caffeine, No alcohol, Limit sugar intake, No spicy food, Avoid processed snacks

Symptoms: Swelling, Stiffness, Redness, Decreased mobility, Aching sensation
Precautions: Avoid overexertion, Maintain healthy weight, Use joint supports, Do regular light exercise, Apply hot/cold packs

Diet Plan: Anti-inflammatory foods, Omega-3 fatty acids, Vitamin D rich food, Leafy greens, Turmeric in diet
Food Restrictions: Avoid red meat, Limit sugar, No fried foods, Avoid alcohol, Cut down on refined carbs

Symptoms: Fatigue, Weakness, Loss of appetite, Low muscle mass, Nutrient deficiency
Precautions: Monitor diet, Eat frequent small meals, Include high-calorie snacks, Track body weight, Avoid skipping meals
Medicines: Appetite stimulants, Multivitamins, Cyproheptadine, Megestrol acetate, Zinc supplements

Diet Plan: High protein foods, Whole grains, Healthy fats, Smoothies with nuts and seeds, Dairy products
